Url.Title: No Legend Features Selected
Url.Abstract: No Legend Features Selected No legend features selected. Problem: You attempted to adjust the curve overlay legend position when no legend features were selected for display.

Url.Title: No Macros Found
Url.Abstract: No Macros Found

Url.Title: No Macros Selected
Url.Abstract: No Macros Selected

Url.Title: No Memory for Autoqueue
Url.Abstract: No Memory for Autoqueue Problem: There is not enough free memory in the system to perform the selected operation.

Url.Title: No Memory for File
Url.Abstract: No Memory for File Problem: There is not enough free memory in the system to read the selected file. Solution:

Url.Title: No Memory for Function
Url.Abstract: No Memory for Function Problem: There is not enough free memory in the system to perform the selected analysis or operation.

Url.Title: No Open Files
Url.Abstract: No Open Files The function that you have selected requires at least one open data file in Universal Analysis. The function cannot be completed without an open data file. Open a data file using the File menu or the tool bar function and repeat the selection.

Url.Title: No Room to Import Records
Url.Abstract: No Room to Import Records Problem: You need to process (autoanalyze) the autoqueue. It has been accumulating records and has now reached at least 90 percent capacity. There is not enough room to paste in another record. If the records are not processed and removed from the autoqueue to allow more space, incoming records will not be appended and will be lost.

Url.Title: No Saved Lines
Url.Abstract: No Saved Lines The Universal Analysis program cannot obtain sufficient dynamic memory from the operating system to save the pixels under graphic cursor lines (markers). Graphic plot cursors will overwrite the plot. No further action is needed.

Url.Title: No Signals Selected
Url.Abstract: No Signals Selected Problem: This error can occur for one of the following reasons: 1. Before a curve overlay graph can be created, you must select signals to plot.

Url.Title: No Valid Signals
Url.Abstract: No Valid Signals Problem: The selected reference file does not contain any signals that can be added to or subtracted from the current data file.

Url.Title: No Values Selected
Url.Abstract: No Values Selected Problem: When selecting frequencies or amplitudes for analysis, you deselected all of the values.

Url.Title: No Visible Features
Url.Abstract: No Visible Features Problem: You have unchecked too many items on the Label Point window. Solution: Check more than one item on the Label Point window before printing the graph.

Url.Title: No Y Axis Selected to Plot
Url.Abstract: No Y Axis Selected to Plot Problem: You selected OK on the Signal Selection window when all y-axes were selected as "not used."

Url.Title: Noncontinuous Data
Url.Abstract: Noncontinuous Data Problem: When the method was run, data storage was turned off between the two analysis limits that you specified.

Url.Title: Not Enough Memory to Import Macro
Url.Abstract: Not Enough Memory to Import Macro Insufficient memory to import macros. Insufficient memory for macro buffers.

Url.Title: Not Enough Partial Areas
Url.Abstract: Not Enough Partial Areas Problem: There are not enough data points to compute the minimum number of partial areas.

Url.Title: Not in Peak
Url.Abstract: Not in Peak Problem: The marker is not within the limits of an existing peak integration. Solution: Repeat the operation, making sure you place the marker within the baseline limits of an existing peak integration.

Url.Title: Not in Same Peak
Url.Abstract: Not in Same Peak Tangent limits not in same peak. Problem: The tangent line limits you selected are in different peaks.

Url.Title: Number Above Limit
Url.Abstract: Number Above Limit The value entered was above the maximum limit for this field. Please enter a smaller value.

Url.Title: Number Below Limit
Url.Abstract: Number Below Limit The value entered was below the minimum limit for this field. Please enter a larger value.

Url.Title: OK to Overwrite?
Url.Abstract: OK to Overwrite? This is a confirmation message to ensure that you want to overwrite the named file with your new file. Choose Yes to overwrite the old file with the new one. Choose No to prevent overwriting and allow you to save the new file with a different name. Select Cancel to abort this operation.

Url.Title: OK to Overwrite Export
Url.Abstract: OK to Overwrite Export This is a confirmation message to ensure that you want to overwrite the named export file with your new file. Choose Yes to overwrite the old file with the new one. Choose No to prevent overwriting and allow you to save the new file with a different name. Select Cancel to abort this operation.

Url.Title: Onset at Super Heat/Cool
Url.Abstract: Onset at Super Heat/Cool Problem: The sample was superheated (or supercooled if a cooling curve) by more than 0.25oC between the peak start and peak maximum, so the program cannot calculate a valid onset tangent.

Url.Title: Onset Outside Peak
Url.Abstract: Onset Outside Peak Problem: The two tangent lines calculated during an Onset Point determina∀tion do not inter∀sect within your selected peak start and stop limits.

Url.Title: Overwrite DOS Records?
Url.Abstract: Overwrite DOS Records? Select OK to overwrite the DOS saved analysis records with the 32-bit Windows analysis records. The file will no longer be able to be read by the DOS Universal Analysis program.

Url.Title: Parameter Block Error
Url.Abstract: Parameter Block Error The parameter block for this data file does not contain the minimum required information, or the data file is stored in a format that cannot be read by this version of Universal Analysis. Check that this is a valid data file by opening the file with a text editor program, such as NotePad, and examine the beginning of the file for textual parameter information.

Url.Title: Peak Must Be Endothermic
Url.Abstract: Peak Must Be Endothermic Problem: In order for this program to work effectively, there must be a complete endothermic peak within the limits that you have specified for analysis.

Url.Title: Peak Overlap
Url.Abstract: Peak Overlap Problem: You attempted to perform an analysis using limits which overlap the baseline of an already defined peak.

Url.Title: Perpendicular at Peak Edge
Url.Abstract: Perpendicular at Peak Edge Problem: The line you drew with the Perpendicular Drop option intersects the edge of the peak.

Url.Title: Printer is Busy
Url.Abstract: Printer is Busy Problem: The requested function cannot be performed because the printer is still busy accepting the previous output.

Url.Title: Problem with Autoqueue File
Url.Abstract: Problem with Autoqueue File Problem: There is something wrong with the autoqueue file. The program requires that certain information be present within the file. This information may have been tampered with or deleted, or the file was not created using TA Instruments Thermal Advantage.

Url.Title: Process the Autoqueue?
Url.Abstract: Process the Autoqueue? This is a message that is displayed each time the autoqueue contains records that need to be autoanalyzed.

Url.Title: Range Exceeds Reference
Url.Abstract: Range Exceeds Reference The data limits that you have selected for your sample data file exceeds the data range found in the chosen reference file. This message asks you if you want to have the data used in the analysis match the data limits found in the reference file.

Url.Title: Recursive Link to Page
Url.Abstract: Recursive Link to Page This message is displayed if you have selected File/Next Report Page to link to a page that is already in the report. Each report page can only appear one time in a custom report.

Url.Title: Recursive Macro
Url.Abstract: Recursive Macro

Url.Title: Redirect All Files?
Url.Abstract: Redirect All Files? This message is displayed if you have relocated a file that was previously saved to a Universal Analysis session in a different location. The file is now missing from its original path and the program has determined that there are other open files with the same directory path.

Url.Title: Reference Invalid
Url.Abstract: Reference Invalid Problem: The current reference file was modified since the file was last used as a reference.

Url.Title: Remove Saved Analysis
Url.Abstract: Remove Saved Analysis This is a confirmation message to ensure that you want to permanently remove the analyses already saved in the current data file. Select Cancel to abort this operation.

Url.Title: Replace String Not Found
Url.Abstract: Replace String Not Found This is an informational message to let you know that the document has been searched and the characters that you entered have not been found in the current document.

Url.Title: Requires Windows 2000/XP
Url.Abstract: Requires Windows 2000/XP Problem: This version of the Universal Analysis cannot run on a non-unicode version of Windows® (e.g., Windows 95, 98, NT, or Me).

Url.Title: Reread the Data?
Url.Abstract: Reread the Data? Problem: This message is displayed if you select Edit/File Information and change the information relating to the data file. Any changes or results that have not been saved will be lost because the file will be reread.

Url.Title: Restore Session
Url.Abstract: Restore Session This is a confirmation message to ensure that you want to restore an already saved session. This action will close all open files and you will lose any analyses already performed. Save any desired analyses for the currently open files before proceeding. Select Cancel to abort this operation.

Url.Title: Retain Current Program Preferences?
Url.Abstract: Retain Current Program Preferences? This message is displayed if you have changed your Universal Analysis program settings since the session you are opening was saved.

Url.Title: Retain Not Selected
Url.Abstract: Retain Not Selected This message occurs if you perform an analysis that is valid for a certain multiplexed signal (e.g., frequency) on a specific curve, then remove that signal from the displayed graph (using Edit/Frequency List for example), and then choose Edit/Delete Results/Select. When the program comes to the result that is no longer displayed on the window, it will display the message above. Select Yes to keep the result named, No to delete the result, or Cancel to abort this operation.

Url.Title: Retain Off the Plot
Url.Abstract: Retain Off the Plot

Url.Title: Retain Plotted vs <X Type>
Url.Abstract: Retain Plotted vs <X Type> This message occurs when you perform an analysis that is valid for a certain X-axis signal, then you change the X-axis signal and choose Edit/Delete Results/Select. When the program comes to the result that is no longer displayed on the window, it will display the message above. Select Yes to keep the result named, No to delete the result, or Cancel to abort this operation.

Url.Title: Retain Result
Url.Abstract: Retain Result This is a message displayed after you have selected Edit/Delete Results/Select. It allows you to selectively choose which result that you want to keep and which result you want to delete. Select Yes to keep the result named, No to delete the result, or Cancel to abort this operation.

Url.Title: Run Time Error
Url.Abstract: Run Time Error Problem: This is a general message that an error has occurred while the program was running.

Url.Title: Running Integral Overlap
Url.Abstract: Running Integral Overlap Problem: You attempted to calculate a running integral of a region of the curve that was already used in a previous running integral calculation.

Url.Title: Running Universal Analysis from a DOS Command Line
Url.Abstract: Running Universal Analysis from a DOS Command Line Instructions and tips on running the Universal Analysis program from a DOS prompt command are provided below in a question and answer format.

Url.Title: Same Fit Limits
Url.Abstract: Same Fit Limits Problem: The limits you selected for a tangent line are the same. Solution: Repeat the analysis, making sure the start and stop limits you select for the tangent line are different.

Url.Title: Same Limits
Url.Abstract: Same Limits Problem: The start and stop data limits you entered are the same. Solution: Either decrease the start limit or increase the stop limit.

Url.Title: Same Tangent Limits
Url.Abstract: Same Tangent Limits Problem: The start and stop limits you entered during a peak integration are the same, resulting in zero width.

Url.Title: Save Analysis Results?
Url.Abstract: Save Analysis Results?

Url.Title: Save Changes?
Url.Abstract: Save Changes? You have elected to exit the Report Editor without saving the file. Choose Yes to save the changes before closing the Report Editor program. Choose No to ignore the changes and close the editor. Select Cancel to abort this operation.

Url.Title: Save File Data with Analysis?
Url.Abstract: Save File Data with Analysis? When you attempt to exit Universal Analysis without saving the analysis results, this confirmation message is displayed after you have answered, "Yes" to the message, "Save analysis results for <filename>. "

Url.Title: Save Font Changes?
Url.Abstract: Save Font Changes? Each localization language has its own set of plot and report fonts. See also: Localization Language

Url.Title: Save Graph Options
Url.Abstract: Save Graph Options This message is displayed after you choose OK on the Graph Options window. This enables you to set up different graph options for each module type or one set of graph options for all module types. These options will be saved in the initialization file.

Url.Title: Save Macros?
Url.Abstract: Save Macros?

Url.Title: Save New Data File?
Url.Abstract: Save New Data File? This message is displayed if you attempt to open a non-TA Instruments data file. The file must be saved in the TA Instruments format before it can be opened using Universal Analysis.

Url.Title: Save Report Template?
Url.Abstract: Save Report Template? This message is displayed when you exit the program and there is a modified custom report template in memory that has not yet been saved. If you want the modified report saved to the template file, click Yes.

Url.Title: Saved Record Read Error
Url.Abstract: Saved Record Read Error Problem: A check sum error was encountered while reading a saved analysis record from a data file. The file is damaged, altered or not compatible with this data analysis program.

Url.Title: Shell Execute Error
Url.Abstract: Shell Execute Error This error is displayed when you attempt to auto launch a Windows® application from the File Open dialog and the attempt fails. The number displayed indicates one of the following error codes:

Url.Title: Delete Curve Results?
Url.Abstract: Delete Curve Results? This message appears when you select Tools/Shift Curve after performing analyses on the curve. If you shift the curve, the results will be lost. If you want to proceed, regardless of the lost results, select Yes. If you do not want to lose the results, select No and the shift will not occur. Select Cancel to abort the operation.

Url.Title: Signal Nonconvergence
Url.Abstract: Signal Nonconvergence Problem: The sigmoidal baseline calculations did not converge on a constant baseline within ten iterations.

Url.Title: Signal Already Selected for Output
Url.Abstract: Signal Already Selected for Output Problem: You attempted to select the same signal twice for output to the new data file.

Url.Title: Signal Already Used in Overlay Plot
Url.Abstract: Signal Already Used in Overlay Plot Problem: Each signal in the analysis program can only be used once in the curve overlay plot.

Url.Title: Signal Not Used
Url.Abstract: Signal Not Used Problem: A selected baseline file signal does not match any of the current data file signals and will not be used.

Url.Title: Signals Out of Range
Url.Abstract: Signals Out of Range The "NSig" parameter in this data file is missing or less than two (the minimum number of signals permitted in a data file). If you have modified this file, then check that the "NSig" parameter is present and correct. Make sure that you save two or more signals for each experiment.

Url.Title: Start Never Reached
Url.Abstract: Start Never Reached The specified start condition for reading data (Time Limit Start, Temperature Limit Start, or Cycle Limit Start) was not found in the data file. Check that you are not entering a temperature limit into a time limit field, or vise versa.

Url.Title: Start with First Step?
Url.Abstract: Start with First Step?

Url.Title: Subscripted Variable Name Too Long
Url.Abstract: Subscripted Variable Name Too Long Problem: A subscripted variable name plus the index in square brackets is more than 30 characters long after the index value is resolved to an integer constant

Url.Title: Subscript Out of Range
Url.Abstract: Subscript Out of Range The subscript provided for a subscripted macro variable is too large or too small. The out-of-range value is shown in the error message.

Url.Title: TA Key Error
Url.Abstract: TA Key Error

Url.Title: Target File is Already Open
Url.Abstract: Target File is Already Open

Url.Title: Text Line Too Long
Url.Abstract: Text Line Too Long Problem: The maximum length of each comment line is 60 characters and you have attempted to add more than 60 characters to the line number noted in the message.

Url.Title: Timed Out While Waiting for Autoqueue
Url.Abstract: Timed Out While Waiting for Autoqueue Problem: The system is trying to add records to the autoqueue from experiments that have been completed on the instrument. The autoqueue file is in use. Perhaps you are editing the autoqueue while the system is trying to add records for autoanalysis. The process has timed out while waiting to access the autoqueue.

Url.Title: Too Many Columns
Url.Abstract: Too Many Columns This message is displayed when you attempt to paste too many columns from the clipboard into a smaller number of highlighted columns in the spreadsheet. For example, if you copy two columns of data to the clipboard and attempt to paste it into one highlighted column on the spreadsheet, you will get this message.

Url.Title: Too Many Records in Autoqueue
Url.Abstract: Too Many Records in Autoqueue Autoqueue file contains too many records. Excess records will be ignored.

Url.Title: Too Many Rows
Url.Abstract: Too Many Rows This message is displayed when you attempt to paste too many rows from the clipboard into a smaller number of highlighted rows in the spreadsheet. For example, if you copy four rows of data to the clipboard and attempt to paste it into one highlighted row on the spreadsheet, you will get this message.

Url.Title: Too Many Signals
Url.Abstract: Too Many Signals The "NSig" parameter in this data file indicates that more than 20 signals (the maximum permitted) are stored in the file. All signals beyond the first 20 will be ignored. Limit the signals saved to 20 or less for each experiment.

Url.Title: Undefined Macro Variable
Url.Abstract: Undefined Macro Variable Undefined macro variable. Problem: A macro variable has been used before it was assigned an initial value.

Url.Title: Unexpected Filename in Macro
Url.Abstract: Unexpected Filename in Macro 1. Deletion of other macro steps. 2. A jump to the wrong macro step. 3. A change in the program state since the original steps were captured.

Url.Title: Unexpected Macro Cursor Position
Url.Abstract: Unexpected Macro Cursor Position 1. Deletion of other macro steps. 2. A jump to the wrong macro step. 3. A change in the program state since the original steps were captured.

Url.Title: Unexpected Macro Text
Url.Abstract: Unexpected Macro Text

Url.Title: Unexpected Message
Url.Abstract: Unexpected Message Unexpected message in macro.

Url.Title: Unexpected Mouse Position
Url.Abstract: Unexpected Mouse Position

Url.Title: Unicode Characters Modified
Url.Abstract: Unicode Characters Modified Unicode characters were modified. Problem: One or more Unicode characters in the data file being read could not be converted to the equivalent Windows® (ANSI) character because the character does not exist in the Windows character set. This version of Universal Analysis cannot process Unicode characters that are not contained in the Windows character set.

Url.Title: Units Must Be W/g
Url.Abstract: Units Must Be W/g Problem: This message is displayed if you have attempted to perform a Purity analysis using a data file with units that are not W/g.

Url.Title: Unrecognized Analysis Record
Url.Abstract: Unrecognized Analysis Record This message is displayed if you have attempted to use a saved analysis or saved session file from a previous version of Universal Analysis. Only Universal Analysis 2000 saved analysis and saved session files are compatible with this version of the program.

Url.Title: Unrecognized Popup Option
Url.Abstract: Unrecognized Popup Option Problem: When you capture a right-click pop-up menu option an edit field, the macro step is captured using the string <popup> followed by the name of the menu item (e.g., "Edit Name <popup>Copy"). If that step is edited to something that is unrecognizable by the program, then this error is posted.

Url.Title: Unrecognized Program Switch
Url.Abstract: Unrecognized Program Switch

Url.Title: Unsupported Parameter Block Version
Url.Abstract: Unsupported Parameter Block Version

Url.Title: Value Cannot be Zero
Url.Abstract: Value Cannot be Zero A value or zero is not permitted for this field. Please enter a non-zero value.

Url.Title: Value Not Defined
Url.Abstract: Value Not Defined Problem: You cannot leave the Value entry field blank. You must assign a value on the Assign Clipboard window or Test Variable window before clicking OK.

Url.Title: Variable Not Defined
Url.Abstract: Variable Not Defined Problem: You cannot leave the Variable entry field blank. You must assign a variable name before clicking OK.

Url.Title: Wrong Exotherm Type
Url.Abstract: Wrong Exotherm Type Problem: The transition direction (exotherm up or down) does not match that of the other signals in the curve overlay plot.

Url.Title: Wrong Number of Points
Url.Abstract: Wrong Number of Points This message is displayed if you try to open a non-TA Instruments data file using Universal Analysis and the program determines that the number of data points in one of the signals is incorrect. The file will not be opened.

Url.Title: Wrong Scale
Url.Abstract: Wrong Scale Problem: You attempted to add a new signal to the curve overlay plot that has a different axis scale type (normal or log) than the existing overlay curves for this axis.

Url.Title: Wrong Units
Url.Abstract: Wrong Units Problem: You attempted to add a curve overlay signal that has different units than the other signal(s) on the axis.

Url.Title: Wrong X Units
Url.Abstract: Wrong X Units Problem: You selected a reference file that has different units for time or temperature than the current data file (e.g., reference time in minutes and sample time in hours).

Url.Title: Zero Peak Width
Url.Abstract: Zero Peak Width Problem: The start and stop peak limits you entered are the same. Solution: Either decrease the start limit or increase the stop limit.

Url.Title: Zero Size
Url.Abstract: Zero Size Problem: The sample size indicated for the file is zero and is needed in a calculation or unit conversion. This will happen if the size was not entered when the data file was created.

Url.Title: Universal Analysis Advantage Integrity Help Topics
Url.Abstract: Universal Analysis Advantage Integrity Help Topics Within the Advantage Integrity system, much of the operation of the Universal Analysis program is unchanged when compared to its nonIntegrity counterpart. Universal Analysis can open both data stored to file (to view historical data) and data stored in the TA database. However, while logged into the Advantage Integrity database, only database record files can be accessed and audit trail generation begins. These two modes of operation (e.g., file-mode and database-mode) are mutually exclusive.

Url.Title: Using an Integrity-Licensed Universal Analysis
Url.Abstract: Using an Integrity-Licensed Universal Analysis Universal Analysis can access and analyze data stored in the Integrity database system, as well as data stored in traditional data files (historical data), but not both at the same time. When logged into the Integrity system, only database records can be accessed. A secure Audit Trail is generated for all actions performed while logged into the database, including the logging in/logging out process. There is no Audit Trail while viewing historical (disk based) data.

Url.Title: Unavailable or Restricted Functions
Url.Abstract: Unavailable or Restricted Functions Within the Advantage Integrity system the TA System Manager can define privileges (e.g., restrict actions) within each module. In Universal Analysis this list of controllable privileges includes most of the menu items. Therefore, typical functions may not be available depending on the Access Group(s) assigned to you. Consult with your TA System Manager to learn about your privilege list for Universal Analysis and Instrument Control.

Url.Title: First Time Login
Url.Abstract: First Time Login When you open any software component of the Advantage Integrity system, either the TA System Manager Program, an Instrument Control program, or the Universal Analysis program, the Log in window is displayed.

Url.Title: Changing Your Password
Url.Abstract: Changing Your Password The Advantage Integrity system relies on password protection to maintain the integrity of the system and the audit trail. Your log in password may be changed at any time desired and must be changed when it expires. The expiration date is set by your TA Instruments System Manager. A few days before your password expires, you will begin to receive "password expiration" notices each time you log in. To change your password, follow these instructions:

Url.Title: Saving Records in the Database
Url.Abstract: Saving Records in the Database Data records are protected and cant be deleted within this system. This applies to the original experimental data, saved analyses (with or without the data), and saved Universal Analysis sessions, as well as PDF (portable document format), or BMP (bitmap) images of data plots and reports generated by Universal Analysis.

Url.Title: Accessing Records in the Database
Url.Abstract: Accessing Records in the Database After logging into the Advantage Integrity-licensed Universal Analysis program, you will need to locate the experiment data in the database for analysis.

Url.Title: Extracting Records from the Database
Url.Abstract: Extracting Records from the Database Occasionally it may be necessary to extract a record from the database to generate a special report or send to TA Instruments for trouble-shooting purposes. When this occurs, the original record remains in the database and cannot be deleted or altered. To extract a record perform the following:

Url.Title: Restoring a Single Record to the Database
Url.Abstract: Restoring a Single Record to the Database Records that have been archived and purged from the database can also be restored one record at a time using the Database Viewer.

Url.Title: Audit Trail Comment Window
Url.Abstract: Audit Trail Comment Window You can add a comment to an existing audit trail entry or add a new audit trail entry to further explain an action or event.

Url.Title: Setting the Sort Order for Tree View
Url.Abstract: Setting the Sort Order for Tree View You can change the way the audit trail information is arranged, or sorted, in the left-hand pane's tree view by clicking the button on the Audit Trail Viewer tool bar or by selecting View/Select Sort Order. This opens the Set Sort Order In Tree View window.

Url.Title: Add Curves Button
Url.Abstract: Add Curves Button Click this button to add curves to the selected axis of the curve overlay window. When you select this button, the Add Overlay Curves Window is displayed.

Url.Title: Deselect All Button
Url.Abstract: Deselect All Button Click this button to deselect (uncheck) all of the files displayed in the list.

Url.Title: Select All Button
Url.Abstract: Select All Button Click this button to select (check) all of the files displayed in the list.

Url.Title: Language Add Button
Url.Abstract: Language Add Button Press this button to add or update a localization language. The program will display a file open dialog. Follow these instructions:

Url.Title: All Button
Url.Abstract: All Button Click this button to select all of the options shown.

Url.Title: Analyze Button
Url.Abstract: Analyze Button Click on this button to select only the Analyze menu items for display in the pop-up menu that appears when you click the right mouse button.

Url.Title: Auto Set Button
Url.Abstract: Auto Set Button Use the Auto Set button to automatically store the position of the cursors (markers) that you selected before you chose Auto Limits from the pop-up menu.

Url.Title: Auto Color Button
Url.Abstract: Auto Color Button Click this button to apply the color settings that are chosen on the Curve Overlay Options  Auto Page.

Url.Title: Auto Line Button
Url.Abstract: Auto Line Button Click this button to apply the line type settings that are chosen on the Curve Overlay Options  Auto Page.

Url.Title: Auto Offset Button
Url.Abstract: Auto Offset Button Click this button to apply the offset settings that are chosen on the Curve Overlay Options  Auto Page.

Url.Title: Auto Symbol Button
Url.Abstract: Auto Symbol Button Click this button to apply the symbol types that are chosen on the Curve Overlay Options  Auto Page.

Url.Title: Axis Names Button
Url.Abstract: Axis Names Button Use this button to edit the font used for the axis names appearing at the sides of the graph. The axis names include the x- and Y-axis names.

Url.Title: Radio Button Blank Header
Url.Abstract: Radio Button Blank Header Select this radio button to have the plot printed or exported with a blank area at the top where a header would have gone, if one were selected.

Url.Title: Browse Button
Url.Abstract: Browse Button Use the Browse button to locate a file or directory from the Open File window.

Url.Title: Cancel Button
Url.Abstract: Cancel Button Use the Cancel button to abort the operation.

Url.Title: Clipboard Button
Url.Abstract: Clipboard Button Click the Clipboard button to copy any text residing on the clipboard to the text field. The source of the text can be another dialog or another application entirely.

Url.Title: Radio Button Current File
Url.Abstract: Radio Button Current File Select this button to associate this audit trail comment with the current data record ID.

Url.Title: Cursor Button
Url.Abstract: Cursor Button Use the Cursor Button to use markers to choose data limits. See also:

Url.Title: Radio Button Custom Header
Url.Abstract: Radio Button Custom Header Select this radio button to have the plot printed or exported with a customized header at the top. When you select this radio button you will need to the desired text in the "Custom header text" area (a maximum of four lines of text can be entered). Click the Font button to set the font attributes for the header.

Url.Title: Data Limits Button
Url.Abstract: Data Limits Button Use the Data Limits button to access the Data Limits window, which allows you to specify a region of the data to be graphed.

Url.Title: Default Button
Url.Abstract: Default Button Use the Default button to display the default settings for this window.

Url.Title: Delete All Button
Url.Abstract: Delete All Button Click this button to remove all of the curves from the curve overlay window. A confirmation message will be displayed before the deletion.

Url.Title: Delete Curves Button
Url.Abstract: Delete Curves Button Click this button to remove selected curves from the curve overlay window. When you select this button, the Delete Overlay Curves Window is displayed.

Url.Title: DMA Button
Url.Abstract: DMA Button Click this button to select the buttons applying to the most common functions available for the DMA (Dynamic Mechanical Analyzer) for display on the tool bar.

Url.Title: DSC Button
Url.Abstract: DSC Button Click this button to select the buttons applying to the most common functions available for the DSC (Differential Scanning Calorimeter) for display on the tool bar.

Url.Title: Edit List Button
Url.Abstract: Edit List/Edit Symbols Button See also:

Url.Title: Export Button
Url.Abstract: Export Button Click this button to export the plot using the options that you have chosen.

Url.Title: Finish Button
Url.Abstract: Finish Button

Url.Title: Font Button
Url.Abstract: Font Button Click this button to display the Font Window , which allows you to choose a font and its characteristics.

Url.Title: Footer Button
Url.Abstract: Footer Button Use this button to edit the font used for the footer information appearing at the bottom of the graph. The footer includes the exotherm direction and program name and version.

Url.Title: General Button
Url.Abstract: General Button Click this button to select the most common functions that apply to all thermal analysis instruments.

Url.Title: Help Button
Url.Abstract: Help Button Use Help to access Help information for the window shown.

Url.Title: English Hint Button
Url.Abstract: English Hint Button Select the English button if you want US English (ENU) to be the hint language for Universal Analysis. All hints will be displayed in English.

Url.Title: Other Hint Button
Url.Abstract: Other Hint Button Select the Other Language Hint button if you want the language selected as "Other" to be the hint language used for Universal Analysis. All hints will then be displayed in the language selected in the Other Language List.

Url.Title: Instr Params Button
Url.Abstract: Instr Params Button Use the Instrument Parameters button, when available, to access the Instrument Parameters window for the data file displayed.

Url.Title: English Language Button
Url.Abstract: English Language Button Select the English button if you want US English (ENU) to be the localization language for Universal Analysis. All text in menus, dialogs, etc. will be displayed in English.

Url.Title: Language Font Button
Url.Abstract: Language Font Button Press this button to examine or change the program font associated with the localization language currently selected in the Other Language List. Any changes to the language font are stored in the Windows registry. Changing the font selection for "English" will also change the font selection for the English language button.

Url.Title: Other Language Button
Url.Abstract: Other Language Button Select the Other button if you want an alternate language to be the localization language for Universal Analysis. All text in menus, dialogs, etc. will be displayed in the language selected in the Other Language Listbox.

Url.Title: Legend Button
Url.Abstract: Legend Button Use this button to edit the font used for the legend appearing on the graph. See the Plot Legend Window for information on setting up a legend.

Url.Title: Load Button
Url.Abstract: Load Button Click the Load button to display the Open Initialization File window, which is used to locate and load an initialization file.

Url.Title: Load Default Program Preferences Button
Url.Abstract: Load Default Program Preferences Button Click the Load Default Program Preferences button to automatically load the program preferences settings that were set originally for the Universal Analysis program when it was received from TA Instruments. This will load the factory settings for the program.

Url.Title: None Button
Url.Abstract: None Button Click this button to select none of the options shown.

Url.Title: Radio Button No Association
Url.Abstract: Radio Button No Association Select this button to have no association with any record for this comment.

Url.Title: Radio Button No Header
Url.Abstract: Radio Button No Header Select this radio button to have the plot printed or exported with a no header and no blank area at the top where a header would have gone, if one were selected. This option moves the entire plot up to take up the whole printed page.

Url.Title: OK Button
Url.Abstract: OK Button Use OK to save the information entered on the window for the current program session only.

Url.Title: Overlay Header Button
Url.Abstract: Overlay Header Button Use this button to edit the font used for the header appearing at the top of the printed overlay graph. The header includes the customizable text that is entered on the Curve Overlay Options  Plot Heading Page .

Url.Title: Params Button
Url.Abstract: Params Button Use this button to display a window that allows you to select and insert common parameters found in the data file parameter block.

Url.Title: Plot Header Button
Url.Abstract: Plot Header Button Use this button to edit the font used for the header appearing at the top of the printed graph. The header includes the sample name, size, method name, comments, operator, run data, and filename. The plot header displayed on the monitor contains only the sample name and filename.

Url.Title: Previous Button
Url.Abstract: Previous Button Use the Previous button to return back to the Open Data File window, which allows you to select and open a different data file.

Url.Title: Printer Setup Button
Url.Abstract: Printer Setup Button Click on this button to select a printer and a printer connection. This command presents a Print Setup dialog box, where you specify the printer and its connection.

Url.Title: Language Remove Button
Url.Abstract: Language Remove Button Press this button to remove the localization language currently selected in the Other Language List. The corresponding language string file is not deleted; it is simply removed from the list of available languages in the Other Language List and from the Windows registry. The selection "English" cannot be removed.

Url.Title: Report Text Button
Url.Abstract: Report Text Button Use this button to edit the font used for the Report Editor. The font can also be changed using the Report Editors Edit/Font menu.

Url.Title: Resolution Button
Url.Abstract: Resolution Button Click this button to open the Label Resolution window, which allows you to adjust the resolution of the values displayed in the table to:

Url.Title: Results Button
Url.Abstract: Results Button Use this button to edit the font used for the results appearing on the graph after an analysis has been performed.

Url.Title: Same As Button
Url.Abstract: Same As Button Use the Same As button to copy the settings used in another file to the current file. The settings that are copied include signals and units selected, graph options, baseline file (if applicable), smoothing, and X-axis scaling.

Url.Title: Save Button
Url.Abstract: Save Button Use the Save button to save the information currently displayed on the window or page as the new settings. This file will be saved to the current initialization (.ini) file. To change the initialization file used by the program, select File/Options to display the Main Options Window  Initialization Page, then select or enter the .ini file to be used.

Url.Title: Save As Button
Url.Abstract: Save As Button Click the Save As button to display the Save Initialization File window, which is used to save the initialization file under a new name or new directory.

Url.Title: Select All Button
Url.Abstract: Select All Button Use this button to choose all of the items displayed.

Url.Title: Signals Button
Url.Abstract: Signals Button Use the Signals button to access the Signal Selection window, which allows you to specify signals from the data file to be graphed.

Url.Title: Radio Button Standard Header
Url.Abstract: Radio Button Standard Header Select this radio button to have the plot printed or exported with the standard TA Instruments header at the top.

Url.Title: Symbols Button
Url.Abstract: Symbols Button Use this button to select the font contained in the Edit Custom symbol list. The symbols can be used to differentiate curves and axes.

Url.Title: TGA Button
Url.Abstract: TGA Button Click this button to select the buttons applying to the most common functions available for the TGA (Thermogravimetric Analyzer) for display on the tool bar.

Url.Title: Tick Labels Button
Url.Abstract: Tick Labels Button Use this button to edit the font used for the tick labels (usually numbers) appearing on the axes of the graph. The tick labels include both the x- and Y-axis tick labels.

Url.Title: TMA Button
Url.Abstract: TMA Button Click this button to select the buttons applying to the most common functions available for the TMA (Thermomechanical Analyzer) for display on the tool bar.

Url.Title: Units Button
Url.Abstract: Units Button Use the Units button to access the Units Selection window, which allows you to specify the units to be graphed.

Url.Title: Calculated Signals
Url.Abstract: Calculated Signals Calculated signals are signals that are available on the Signal Selection window, but are not stored in the instrument data file. Calculated signals are computed "on-the-fly" when needed.

Url.Title: Checkbox Adjust Heat of Fusion According to Correction Factor
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Adjust Heat of Fusion According to Correction Factor Check the Adjust heat of fusion according to area correction factor to perform a calculation on the data that will adjust the change in the heat of fusion using the correction factor entered in the field above.

Url.Title: Checkbox Adjust TGA Weight Derivative For Modify Size
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Adjust TGA Weight Derivative For Modify Size Check this box to have the TGA weight derivative adjusted when a Modify Size analysis is performed.

Url.Title: Checkbox Allow Multiple Sessions of UA
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Allow Multiple Sessions of UA Check this box to enable a new session of the Universal Analysis program to open each time the icon is selected (multiple copies of the program will be running at the same time). If the box is not checked, the current session of the program will be activated each time the icon is selected.

Url.Title: Show All Curves Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Show All Curves Checkbox Check this box to display all available data curves in the inset view. If this item is not checked, only the current curve is displayed in the inset view. Click here for an example of an inset view showing only the current curve.

Url.Title: Checkbox Include All Cycles
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Include All Cycles Check the Include all cycles after delay time to use all of the cyclic data that was generated after the delay time specified.

Url.Title: Checkbox All Data Points
Url.Abstract: Checkbox All Data Points Check this box to use all of the points available in the data file for your data table.

Url.Title: All Text
Url.Abstract: All Text Check the All Text box to display a complete list of the parameter block entries from the selected (highlighted) data file. The information displayed will include all data file information plus signal and calibration information, etc.

Url.Title: Show Arrow to Curve Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Show Arrow to Curve Checkbox Check this box to show an arrow pointing from the inset view to its source on the curve. Click here for an example of an inset view with an arrow shown.

Url.Title: Checkbox Autoscale New Data X Axis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Autoscale New Data Limits X Axis Check the Autoscale New Data X-Axis box to have the data files x axis autoscaled. When checked the current files x-axis data will be autoscaled when the program reads in new data for Graph/Data Limits, Tools/Linear Transform, or a new Graph/X axis. This is the default setting. (This applies to single files onlyit does not apply to curve overlay.)

Url.Title: Checkbox Autoscale New Data Y Axis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Autoscale New Data Limits Y Axis Check the Autoscale New Data Y-Axis box to have the data files y axis autoscaled. When checked the current files y-axis data will be autoscaled when the program reads in new data for Graph/Data Limits, Tools/Linear Transform, or a new Graph/Y axis. This is the default setting. (This applies to single files onlyit does not apply to curve overlay.)

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto Axis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto Axis Check the Axis box to automatically configure the Show Color, Symbol, and Line Type options for each overlay axis.

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto Color
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto Color Check the Color box to automatically apply the Auto Color settings, found on the Curve Overlay Options  Auto Page, to the curve overlay graph. To change the Auto Color settings after auto configure is complete, use the Curve Overlay Options  Curves Page to adjust the color for each curve.

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto Curve offset
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto Curve Offset Check the Curve Offset box to automatically apply the Auto Offset settings from the Curve Overlay Options  Auto Page to each axis in the curve overlay plot. To change the offset settings, use the Overlay/Manual Setup function to manually adjust the offset for each curve in the overlay plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto File Selection
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto File Selection Check the File Selection box to automatically include all of the opened files for curve overlay. You can then uncheck any files that you do not want to include.

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto Launch
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto Launch Check this box to have the program automatically run (launch) the Windows® application associated with the file extension of the current file. For example, if this box is checked and you open a file with the .pdf extension in Universal Analysiss File Open window, the program will run Acrobat Reader and display the file.

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto Legend
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto Legend Check the Legend box to automatically apply the legend settings, that the program will optimize for you, to the curve overlay graph. To change the Legend settings, use the Curve Overlay Options  Legend Page.

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto Line
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto Line Check the Line box to automatically apply the Auto Line settings, found on the Curve Overlay Options  Auto Page, to the curve overlay graph. To change the Auto Line settings after auto configure is complete, use the Curve Overlay Options  Curves Page to adjust the line type for each curve.

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto Refresh Data
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto Refresh Data Check the "Auto refresh data every xx seconds" box to automatically refresh the plotted data from an active data file (real time plot), without losing completed results. If you select this checkbox, you must enter the minimum amount of time delay between refresh actions. The default time is five seconds.

Url.Title: Checkbox Auto Symbol
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Auto Symbol Check the Symbol box to automatically apply the Auto Symbol settings, found on the Curve Overlay Options  Auto Page, to the curve overlay graph. To change the Auto Symbol settings after auto configure is complete, use the Curve Overlay Options  Curves Page to adjust the symbol type for each curve.

Url.Title: Checkbox Baseline File Signals
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Baseline File Signals Check the box next to each signal to be used for the desired operation. Those signals that are not compatible between files are not used.

Url.Title: Border Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Border Checkbox Check the border box to have a box placed around the legend. When the box is checked the legend is opaque (nothing behind it will show). When the box is not checked, there is no border and the legend is transparent (anything behind it will show through).

Url.Title: Checkbox Break Data on Gas Switch or Event Mark
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Break Data on Gas Switch or Event Mark Check the Break Data on Gas Switch or Event Mark box to have any gas switch and event marks that are contained in the data file plotted as if they were breaks in the data. This is the default condition. This allows gas switch and/or event marks to be used for the Cycle Limits.

Url.Title: Checkbox Column Name
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Column Name Check this display option to have the results values labeled with the name of the result at the column heading. For example, column names might include Onset, End, Start, Stop, Weight, Temperature, etc.

Url.Title: Checkbox Column Units
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Column Units Check this display option to have the results values labeled with the units of the result in the column heading. For example, column units might include °C, mg, %, J/g, etc.

Url.Title: Checkbox Confirm File Close with Unsaved Results
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Confirm File Close with Unsaved Results Check this box to display a message whenever you attempt to close a data file without saving the analysis results that you have already generated. This allows you to choose to save the results, if desired.

Url.Title: Checkbox Create Integrity Item Access Files
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Create Integrity Item Access Files Check this box to create a new Universal Analysis item access file for use with the Integrity database system. This checkbox is not saved in the initialization file. The item access file is created immediately when the OK button is pressed. The files are stored in the directory containing the Universal Analysis program executable file (WinUA.exe). Refer to the TA System Manager program for more information on using these files.

Url.Title: Checkbox Create PDF File with Saved Analysis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Create PDF File with Saved Analysis Check this box to display a PDF File Save As dialog immediately after saving an analysis (File/Save Analysis function). This box is unchecked by default. If you do not want to save the PDF file, select Cancel in the Save As dialog. The analysis file is still saved.

Url.Title: Draw arrow to point
Url.Abstract: Draw arrow to point Check this box to have an arrow displayed that will point from the label(s) to the selected data point on the graph.

Url.Title: Checkbox Draw Border
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Draw Border Check this box to draw a border box around the label text.

Url.Title: Draw cross at point
Url.Abstract: Draw cross at point Check this box to have an cross displayed at the selected data point on the graph.

Url.Title: Checkbox Draw Sigmoidal Baseline Iterations
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Draw Sigmoidal Baseline Iterations Check this box to have intermediate sigmoidal baseline iterations shown on the graph during peak integrations.

Url.Title: Checkbox Enable Analysis Log
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Enable Analysis Log  Check the Enable analysis log box on the Main OptionsOther Page, if you want to enable the capture of the Analysis log for all open data files. This is the default.

Url.Title: Checkbox Exact Scaling X Axis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Exact Scaling X Axis Check the Exact Scaling X-Axis box to have the plot axis using the exact range of the x-coordinates found in the data file or rescale zoom box.

Url.Title: Checkbox Exact Scaling Y Axis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Exact Scaling Y Axis Check the Exact Scaling Y-Axis box to have the plot axis using the exact range of the y-coordinates found in the data file or rescale zoom box.

Url.Title: Checkbox Expand Heat Flow Signal Names
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Expand Heat Flow Signal Names Check the Expand heat flow signal names box to automatically replace the heat flow signal name in a Tzero data file with the full signal name from the parameter block (e.g., Heat Flow T4). The signal name is replaced in memory only when the data file is initially opened. The "SelHeatFlow" parameter that specifies the full signal name must appear in the data file parameter block. The data file is not modified.

Url.Title: Checkbox File Name
Url.Abstract: Checkbox File Name Check this box to display the name of the file from which the curve was selected. The filename appears on the Curve Overlay Options  Curves Page and may be edited.

Url.Title: Flat Buttons
Url.Abstract: Flat Buttons

Url.Title: Flyover Help
Url.Abstract: Fly-Over Help Check this box to display a small text box, called fly-over help, containing the name of the button as you move the pointer over the buttons. (This type of help is also called tool tip help or screen tip help.)

Url.Title: Checkbox Ignore Breaks in Data
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Ignore Breaks in Data Check the Ignore Breaks in Data box to have the data file plotted with a continuous curve, regardless of any breaks in the data points, each time a data file is opened. The data will be interpolated to create an unbroken curve.

Url.Title: Checkbox Ignore Invalid Data
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Ignore Invalid Data Check the Ignore Invalid Data box to have the data file plotted with a continuous curve, regardless of any invalid data points, each time a data file is opened. Straight lines will be drawn between valid points. The data will not be interpolated for analysis or curve hit testing.

Url.Title: Checkbox Initialize Plotter
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Initialize Plotter Check the Initialize plotter box to reset the plotter parameters to the default settings. We recommend that you check this box.

Url.Title: Show View Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Show View Checkbox Check this box to show the graph in the inset view. If this box is not checked, the inset view will not be displayed.

Url.Title: Inverted (Integral Type)
Url.Abstract: Inverted (Integral Type) Check the Inverted box to cause the normal integral to be multiplied by minus one, and the area percent integral to be computed from 100 percent down to zero percent.

Url.Title: Checkbox Use Known Pure Melting Temperature
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Use Known Pure Melting Temperature Check the box for Use known purge melting temperature to perform purity calculations on your data using the known melting temperature of the pure sample material. If you check this box, you will need to enter the value for the melting temperature in °C.

Url.Title: Cell Constant
Url.Abstract: Cell Constant Check this box to display the Cell Constant value. Cell Constant is a calibration factor used to adjust the calorimetric response of a DSC cell. The cell constant is the ratio of the known value to the measured experimental variable. Typically, the heat of fusion of indium (DSC) is used. The calibration is based on a run made in the calibration mode using the experimental conditions to be used in subsequent measurements.

Url.Title: Correction
Url.Abstract: Correction Check this box to display the Correction value in percent. This is the area expressed as a percent of the total melting enthalpy that is added to the fractional areas in order to produce the straight line form of the vant Hoff equation.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Curves
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Curves Check this box to label the adsorption and desorption portions of the result curve.

Url.Title: Delta H
Url.Abstract: Delta H Check this box to display the Delta H value in kJ/mol. This is the change in the heat of fusion.

Url.Title: Depression
Url.Abstract: Depression Check this box to display the vant Hoff melting point depression value in the purity analysis results. This is the difference between the melting temperature of this sample and that of a 100 percent pure sample.

Url.Title: Melting Point
Url.Abstract: Melting Point Check this box to display the melting point in the results annotation. Melting point is defined as the point at which the crystals of a pure substance are in equilibrium with the liquid phase at atmospheric pressure. This point is commonly referred to as melting point when a substance is approaching it from its solid state and is referred to as freezing point when a substance is approaching it from its liquid state.

Url.Title: Molecular Weight
Url.Abstract: Molecular Weight Check this box to display the Molecular Weight in g/mol. This is the value that you have entered during the purity analysis, which is defined as the mass of one molecule of a nonionic substance in atomic mass units.

Url.Title: Onset Slope
Url.Abstract: Onset Slope Check this box to display the Onset Slope in the purity analysis results. This parameter is the slope of the onset of the melting curve for a standard. The onset slope, or thermal resistance, is a measure of the temperature drop that occurs in a melting sample in relation to the thermocouple. Theoretically, a standard sample should melt at a constant temperature. As it melts and draws more heat, a temperature difference develops between the sample and the sample thermocouple. The thermal resistance between these two points is calculated as the onset slope of the heat flow versus temperature curve on the front side of the melting peak. This is always a negative term. Default is 0.00 mW/°C.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Onset Temperature
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Onset Temperature Check this box to label the peak with the temperature at the onset point. Checking this box causes the specific temperature value to be included unconditionally. For example, if x axis is selected and temperature is also selected, and temperature is the current x-axis signal, then only one temperature value will be included in the label. This also applies to time and x-signal.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Onset Time
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Onset Time Check this box to label the peak with the time at the onset point. Checking this box causes the specific x value to be included unconditionally. For example, if time is selected and time is also selected, and time is the current x-axis signal, then only one time value will be included in the label. This also applies to temperature and x-signal.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Onset X Axis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Onset X Axis Check this box to label the peak with the x-axis value at the onset point. This option applies to Onset Point and Peak Integration analyses and is reported in the results report.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Onset X-Signal
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Onset X-Signal Check this box to label the peak with the x signal at the onset point. Checking this box causes the specific x value to be included unconditionally. For example, if x axis is selected and time is also selected, and time is the current x-axis signal, then only one time value will be included in the label. This also applies to temperature and x-signal.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Onset Y Axis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Onset Y Axis Check this box to label the peak with the y-axis value at the onset point. This option applies to Onset Point and Peak Integration analyses and is reported in the results report.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Peak with Area
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Peak with Area Check this box to label the peak with the peak area. See also:

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Peak with Height
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Peak with Height Check this box to label the peak with the height.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Peak with Limits
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Peak with Limits Check this box to label the peak with the chosen analysis limits for integration.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Peak with Width at Half Height
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Peak with Width at Half Height Check this box to label the peak with its width at the half height point.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Peak with Normalized Area
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Peak with Normalized Area (Available for DSC and DTA data only.) Check this box to label the peak with the normalized area, otherwise, unnormalized area is reported.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Peak with Signed Heat Flow Area
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Peak with Signed Heat Flow Area Check this box to label the peak with the appropriate exotherm/endotherm designation. If the peak area is exothermic, the value will be labeled as positive (implied no sign displayed). If the peak area is endothermic, the value will be labeled as negative (minus sign displayed).

Url.Title: Checkbox Purity
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Purity Check the Purity box to display the purity in the results annotation, the amount of a specified compound or element in an impure sample.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Results with Curve Color
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Results with Curve Color Check this box to have all new results labels drawn with the same color as that of the currently selected curve.

Url.Title: RMS Deviation
Url.Abstract: RMS Deviation Check this box to display the RMS Deviation in the purity analysis results. Root Mean Square Deviation is the estimate of the deviation in the melting temperature of the 100 percent pure sample.

Url.Title: Checkbox Legend Text
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Legend Text Check this box to display the customizable text for all of the curves in the legend. You can turn this function off individually for each curve on the Curve Overlay Options  Curves Page (text can be customized there as well).

Url.Title: Checkbox Manual Tangent Selection
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Manual Tangent Selection Check the Manual tangent selection box if you want to manually select the start and stop limits for each tangent line used in the analysis. If you choose the manual mode, the program uses the limits you select to fit the tangent lines to the curve.

Url.Title: Module ID Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Module ID Checkbox Check the Module ID box to have the name of the instrument placed in the legend.

Url.Title: Multiplexed Signal Table Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Multiplexed Signal Table Checkbox Check the Multiplexed Signal Table box to display the values of the multiplex signal (e.g., DMA and DEA frequency and DMA amplitude). If a symbol is used to distinguish these curves then it will be displayed next to each value.

Url.Title: Multiplex Value
Url.Abstract: Multiplex Value Check this box to label the selected data point on the graph with the multiplex value (such as frequency, amplitude, or location).

Url.Title: Checkbox Multiplex Value
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Multiplex Value Check this display option to have the results values labeled with the multiplex value for that result. For example, you can have the results labeled with the frequency values.

Url.Title: Checkbox Negative Offsets
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Negative Offsets Check this box to apply the offset negatively (downward) versus positively (upwards) for the selected offset option.

Url.Title: Normalized (Integral Type)
Url.Abstract: Normalized (Integral Type) For DSC Data Only: Check the Normalized box to plot the integral curve in normalized units (Joules/g). NOTE: A sample size must be specified.

Url.Title: Checkbox No Data Breaks or Flags
Url.Abstract: Checkbox No Data Breaks or Flags Check this box to export your data file without any data break or data flags such as cycle markers, gas on/off changes, or event on/off changes. This allows you to remove data breaks that may hinder your use of the data in spreadsheet applications. When this item is checked, the minus time flags are removed from the data and all points appear connected. Note that if you check this option, the data breaks cannot be restored to the exported file.

Url.Title: Checkbox No Invalid Data
Url.Abstract: Checkbox No Invalid Data Check this box to exclude all report lines that contain invalid data values. Lines that contain both valid and invalid data are also excluded.

Url.Title: Checkbox No Invalid Data Points
Url.Abstract: Checkbox No Invalid Data Points Check this box to remove any invalid data points that are present in the data file from the exported data file. These invalid points will be replaced with a single data break for each group of invalid points. NOTE: If the optionNo data breaks or flagsis checked along with this checkbox, no data break will be inserted in place of the invalid points in the exported data file.

Url.Title: Checkbox No Parameter Block
Url.Abstract: Checkbox No Parameter Block Check this box to export your data file without any parameter block information. Note that if you check this option, the exported file will not be able to be opened in Universal Analysis as a data file, because there will no longer be any parameter block information available.

Url.Title: Checkbox Onset at Inflection
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Onset at Inflection This box applies to Onset and Oxidation analysis with automatic (2-point) cursors.

Url.Title: Show Partial Results Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Show Partial Results Checkbox Check this box to display any results whose limits may be partially in and partially outside the area selected for the inset view. Click here for an example of an inset view showing partial results.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot Adsorption Data
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot Adsorption Data Check this box to include adsorption (weight gain/increasing %RH) data in the results plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot BET Data
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot BET Data Check this box to include the raw BET data in the results plot. The raw data is drawn on plot axis Y1.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot BET Fit Line
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot BET Fit Line Check this box to include the BET fit data in the results plot. The slope and intercept from the BET fit are used to generate data points for this curve. The fit data is drawn on the Y4 plot axis.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot Fitted Line to Corrected Partial Area Points
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot Fitted Line to Corrected Partial Area Points Check the Plot fitted line to corrected partial area points box, if desired. If you check this box, a line will be drawn through the temperature versus corrected partial area points, only if plot temperature vs. corrected partial area points box is also checked.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot Temperature vs. Corrected Partial Area Points
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot Temperature vs. Corrected Partial Area Points Check the Plot temperature vs. corrected partial area points box to display a graph of the temperature versus the corrected partial area points.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot Data Outside of Analysis Range
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot Data Outside of Analysis Range Check the Plot Data Outside of Analysis Range box to have the data that falls outside of the analysis range plotted, but grayed out. Data outside the analysis range is plotted in the "Plot Grid" color.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot Desorption Data
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot Desorption Data Check this box to include desorption (weight loss/decreasing %RH) data in the results plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot GAB Data
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot GAB Data Check this box to include the raw GAB data in the results plot. The raw data is drawn on plot axis Y1.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot GAB Fit Curve
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot GAB Fit Curve Check this box to include the GAB fit data in the results plot. The Wm, Cg, and K constants from the GAB fit are used to generate data points for this curve. The fit data is drawn on plot axis Y4.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot Partial Area Slices
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Indicate Partial Area Slices on Heat Flow Curve Check the Indicate partial area slices on Heat Flow curve box to have partial areas shown on the resulting heat flow curve.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot Fitted Modified Van't Hoff Equation to Uncorrected Partial Area Points
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot Fitted Modified Van't Hoff Equation to Uncorrected Partial Area Points Check the Plot fitted modified vant Hoff equation to uncorrected partial area points box, if desired. If you check the fifth box, a plot will be fitted to the temperature versus uncorrected partial area points, only if plot temperature vs. uncorrected partial area points box is also checked.

Url.Title: Checkbox Plot Temperature vs. Uncorrected Partial Area Points
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Plot Temperature vs. Uncorrected Partial Area Points Check the Plot temperature vs. uncorrected partial area points box to display a graph of the temperature versus the uncorrected partial area points.

Url.Title: Preview
Url.Abstract: Preview Check the Preview box to display a brief list of parameter block entries from the selected (highlighted) data file. This information will also be displayed in the Data File Information window for that file.

Url.Title: Checkbox Prompt for Integrity Login
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Prompt for Integrity Login Check this box on the Main Options  Initialization Page, if you want Universal Analysis to automatically prompt for login to the Integrity database system when the program is started. If this box is unchecked, then Universal Analysis will not attempt to query the database on start up.

Url.Title: Checkbox Refresh Data Before Desmearing
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Refresh Data Before Desmearing Check this box to have the data file read again (refreshed) before applying the desmearing function.

Url.Title: Show Region Border Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Show Region Border Checkbox Check this box to leave a dotted line around the region chosen for the inset view. Click here for an example of an inset view with the region shown as a dotted line.

Url.Title: Checkbox Reset Time to Zero
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Reset Time to Zero Check this box to reset the Time signal to zero at the start of the specified data limits region. You should find this option is most useful for oxidation time experiments where the conditioning portion of the experiment is not plotted or analyzed.

Url.Title: Checkbox Restore Saved Analysis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Restore Saved Analysis Use this option to return the data file back to the state it was in when Save Analysis was selected.

Url.Title: Show Results on Plot Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Show Results on Plot Checkbox Check this box to show any analysis results contained in the inset region on the main plot and the inset view.

Url.Title: Checkbox File Name
Url.Abstract: Checkbox File Name Check this display option to have the results labeled with the associated file name (without the file path) at the end of the result line.

Url.Title: Checkbox Report Heading
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Report Heading Check this display option to have the report heading displayed on your results report. The report heading includes the filename, run date, program name, run number, instrument name, sample, sample size, operator, method, and comments.

Url.Title: Checkbox Result Notes
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Result Notes This display option applies only to TGA Modify Size results. Check this item to have the footnote that is generated displayed in the results report.

Url.Title: Checkbox Sample ID
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Sample ID Check this display option to have the results labeled with the sample identification text at the end of the result line.

Url.Title: Checkbox Result Separator
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Result Separator Check this display option to have a blank line inserted between each block of results to separate them in the results report.

Url.Title: Checkbox Result Type
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Result Type Check this display option to have the result type (type of analysis performed) displayed on your results report. Selecting this option displays everything that is both checked in the list to the left and available to report. For example, result types can include Step Transition, Weight Change, Residue, Peak Area, etc.

Url.Title: Checkbox Scale X
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Scale X Check this box to automatically scale the X axis when the curve overlay functions are used.

Url.Title: Checkbox Scale Y1
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Scale Y1 Check this box to automatically scale the Y1 axis when the curve overlay functions are used.

Url.Title: Checkbox Scale Y2
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Scale Y2 Check this box to automatically scale the Y2 axis when the curve overlay functions are used.

Url.Title: Checkbox Scale Y3
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Scale Y3 Check this box to automatically scale the Y3 axis when the curve overlay functions are used.

Url.Title: Checkbox Scale Y4
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Scale Y4 Check this box to automatically scale the Y4 axis when the curve overlay functions are used.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Annotation
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Annotation Check this box to display the result legend or result label on the plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Axis
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Axis Check this box to show the axis label and tick marks for the selected Y-axis. Uncheck this box, if you want the axis data to be drawn without an axis label or tick marks.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Axis Name (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Axis Name (Export Plot Options) Check one or more of these boxes to include the Y1, Y2, Y3, Y4, and/or X-axes names on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Color
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Color Check this box to show the color selected in the following places: axis label (when using the Axes Page) or legend (when using the Legend Page).

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Comment (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Comment (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the comment text that appears in the data file on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Directories
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Directories (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the file name and directory location of the data file path in the header of the exported plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Exotherm Direction (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Exotherm Direction (Export Plot Options) Check this box to show the direction that you have chosen for the exotherm. See also: Exotherm Up/Down.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show File (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show File (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the name of the data file on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Frame (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Frame (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the frame around the exported plot.

Url.Title: Show Hint Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Show Hint Checkbox Check this box to turn on the language hint system. Uncheck this box to disable language hints. You can also activate/deactivate language hints in most dialogs and windows by typing Ctrl-H on the keyboard.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Instrument (Export Plot)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Instrument (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the instrument name that appears in the parameter block of the data file on the exported plot. If there is no instrument name in the parameter block for the data file, this option will not appear on the exported plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Legend
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Legend Check this box to display the humidity legend text in a Plot Legend at the top of the result plot. The text to be displayed is entered in the legend entry field to the right of the checkbox.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Line Type
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Line Type Check this box to show the line type in the following places: axis label (when using the Axes Page) or legend (when using the Legend Page).

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Method (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Method (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the method name used to collect the data that appears in the data file on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Module (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Module (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the name (acronym) of the module used to collect the data that appears in the data file on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Operator (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Operator (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the operator name that appears in the data file on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Program Version (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Program Version (Export Plot Options) Check this box to show the program version number on your plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Run Date (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Run Date (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the run date that appears in the data file on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Sample (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Sample (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the sample name that appears in the data file on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Size (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Size (Export Plot Options) Check this box to include the sample size that appears in the data file on the export plot.

Url.Title: Show String Number Checkbox
Url.Abstract: Show String Number Checkbox Check this box to append the language string number(s) to the beginning of the hint text. This is especially useful for determining which string in a language file is used to generate a text string in the program. The same string numbers apply to the built-in English strings.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Symbol
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Symbol Check this box to show the symbol selected in the following places: axis label (when using the Axes Page) or legend (when using the Legend Page).

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Symbols
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Symbols Check this box to enable plot symbols on the currently selected axis. If the symbol type is set to "No Symbols," then checking this box has no effect.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Tick Labels (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Tick Labels (Export Plot Options) Check one or more of these boxes to include the Y1, Y2, Y3, Y4, and/or X-axes tick labels on the export plot.

Url.Title: Checkbox Show Tick Marks (Export Plot Options)
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Show Tick Marks (Export Plot Options) Check one or more of these boxes to include the Y1, Y2, Y3, Y4, and/or X-axes tick marks on the export plot.

Url.Title: Show Tool Bar
Url.Abstract: Show Tool Bar Check this box to display the tool bar on the main window of the Universal Analysis program. If the box is not checked, no tool bar is displayed.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Signal Change
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Signal Change Check this box to label the graph with the signal change.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Signal Change with Signed Change
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Signal Change with Signed Change Check this box to label the graph with the appropriately signed signal change value. If the change is negative, a minus sign will be shown with the numerical value. If the change is positive, no sign will be shown with the numerical value, positive is implied.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Signal Change with X Limits
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Signal Change with X Limits Check this box to label the graph with the value at the x-axis limit points.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label Signal Change with Y Limits
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label Signal Change with Y Limits Check this box to label the graph with the value at the y-axis limit points.

Url.Title: Checkbox Signal Name
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Signal Name Check this display option to have the results values labeled with the signal name for that result. For example, signal names might include heat flow (DSC), weight (TGA), etc.

Url.Title: Checkbox Smooth Curve for Next File.
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Smooth Curve for Next File Check this box if you would like to save and apply the smoothing region again each time the selected signal is read from the data file.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label with Change
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label with Change Check this box to label the graph with the step/glass transition signal change.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label with Delta Cp
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Label with Delta Cp Check this box to label the graph with the heat capacity. NOTE: This step label is available for DSC heat flow curves only.

Url.Title: Checkbox Label with End
