Url.Abstract: File Name (Macro Insert Menu) Use the File Name option to insert a macro step that will identify the specified file (data file, session file, etc.) to open or save when the macro step runs. Select the desired position, which should be immediately after a captured "Open File" or "Save File" step. Then select Insert/File Name from the Macro Editor window. The Macro File Name window is displayed to allow you to locate or enter the desired path and filename.

Url.Title: Initialize (Macro Insert Menu)
Url.Abstract: Initialize (Macro Insert Menu) Use the Initialize option to insert a step that will open an initialization (.ini) file into your macro. When this option is selected, the Macro Initialize window is displayed to allow you to choose an .ini file. After you select OK, the program will insert the initialize step that recalls this file. It is best to insert an Initialize step as the first step in your macro.

Url.Title: Jump (Macro Insert Menu)
Url.Abstract: Jump (Macro Insert Menu) Use the Jump option to display the Macro Jump Window, which allows you to insert a step that jumps to a different step in the macro. Select the desired position for the jump before selecting this option.

Url.Title: Stop Macro (Macro Insert Menu)
Url.Abstract: Stop Macro (Macro Insert Menu) Select the Stop option to insert a step that automatically stops the running of the macro. Select the desired position for the stop before selecting this option.

Url.Title: Test Variable (Macro Insert Menu)
Url.Abstract: Test Variable (Macro Insert Menu) The Test Variable macro step is used to compare the current value of a macro variable with another variable or constant for conditional branching inside the macro. If the test condition is true then the macro will jump to the specified next step, otherwise macro execution will continue with the macro step immediately following the test variable step.

Url.Title: Wait Accept (Macro Insert Menu)
Url.Abstract: Wait Accept (Macro Insert Menu) Select the Wait Accept option to insert a step that will stop the running of the macro to wait for the operator to choose Accept Limits from the analysis pop-up menu. Once the Accept Limits option has been selected, the macro will continue.

Url.Title: Wait OK (Macro Insert Menu)
Url.Abstract: Wait OK (Macro Insert Menu) Select the Wait OK option to insert a step that will stop the running of the macro to wait for the operator to press the OK button on a window. Once the OK button has been pressed, the macro will continue.

Url.Title: Copy (Macro Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Copy (Macro Edit Menu) Use the Copy menu item to copy a step from a macro to the clipboard for retrieval by pasting.

Url.Title: Cut (Macro Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Cut (Macro Edit Menu) Use the Cut menu item to remove a selected step from a macro and simultaneously copy it to the clipboard for retrieval by pasting.

Url.Title: Delete (Macro Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Delete (Macro Edit Menu) Use the Delete menu item to remove a step from a macro. 1. Ensure that the macro you want to edit is active by opening the desired macro.

Url.Title: Delete All (Macro Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Delete All (Macro Edit Menu) Use the Delete All menu item to remove all of the steps from a macro. 1. Ensure that the macro you want to edit is active by opening the desired macro.

Url.Title: Delete to End (Macro Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Delete to End (Macro Edit Menu) Use the Delete to End menu item to remove the steps from a selected point to the end of the macro.

Url.Title: Modify Step (Macro Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Modify Step (Macro Edit Menu) Use the Modify function to edit certain macro steps. You can edit steps that contain a text entry, insert parameter, cursor or mouse coordinate, checkbox or radio button selection, or color selection. You cannot, for instance, change a button selection; you must delete, then recapture these steps.

Url.Title: Paste (Macro Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Paste (Macro Edit Menu) Use the Paste menu item to insert the macro step, which was previously copied to the clipboard (using either Cut or Copy), into the macro at the selected place.

Url.Title: Watch List (Macro Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Watch List (Macro Edit Menu) Use the Watch List function to open a stay-on-top window that is used to debug macros containing variables. When you select this function, the Watch List window is displayed, which contains a pop-up menu to allow you to observe the variables that occur in either one or all of the macros contained in the current macro file.

Url.Title: Help on Macro Editor
Url.Abstract: Help on Macro Editor Use this menu item to display the help available on how to use the Macro Editor.

Url.Title: Macro Editor Help Topics
Url.Abstract: Macro Editor Help Topics Use this menu item to display the topics available in the online help associated with the Macro Editor program.

Url.Title: Autoqueue (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Autoqueue (Macro) Use this menu item to open the Autoqueue window, which is used to edit the autoqueue.

Url.Title: Capture On/Off
Url.Abstract: Capture On/Off Use the Capture On function to begin (checked) or stop (unchecked) the capture process to build to macro. The option toggles on and off. You can use either the Capture On menu option or the shortcut, Ctrl+T, to toggle the capture function on and off.

Url.Title: Copy (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Copy (Macro) Select the Copy menu item to copy the listed information into a new macro. The Macro Information window is displayed to allow you to rename the copied macro.

Url.Title: Delete (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Delete (Macro) Select Delete to delete the current macro. A message box is displayed to confirm removal of this macro.

Url.Title: Delete All (Macros)
Url.Abstract: Delete All (Macros) Select Delete All to delete all of the macros contained in the current macro file. A message is displayed to confirm deletion of all macros in the file. You can use this option to create a new, empty, macro file by selecting Save As, then renaming the file with a new name.

Url.Title: Execute (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Execute (Macro) Select Execute to run (or execute) a macro that you select from the list of macros available in the current macro file. This function can be included as a macro step that executes another macro within the current macro.

Url.Title: Import (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Import (Macro) Use the Import function to import a macro that will be added to the current macro file. This function displays the Open (file) window. After you select the macro file to open, you will see the Macro Import window. Check the desired macro(s) to import to the macro file and select OK.

Url.Title: Information (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Information (Macro) Select Information to display the Macro Information window for the currently open macro.

Url.Title: Load File (Macro File)
Url.Abstract: Load File (Macro File) Select Load to load a different macro file. This function displays the Open (file) window, allowing you to specify an existing macro file.

Url.Title: New (Macro)
Url.Abstract: New (Macro) Use the New option to display the Macro Information window, which allows you to enter a name and description for the newest macro before you begin to capture the first step.

Url.Title: New File (Macro File)
Url.Abstract: New File (Macro File) Select New File to create a new macro file. When you select this function, a new, empty macro file is set up in memory by deleting all currently-loaded macros. The Save As window is displayed. Enter a new name for your macro file, then click the Save button. You will then be ready to create new macros to be stored in this new macro file.

Url.Title: Open (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Open (Macro) Select the Open menu item to display a list of the existing macros to allow you to open a different macro to edit and/or execute.

Url.Title: Print (Macros)
Url.Abstract: Print (Macros) Use this command to print a macro. This command presents a Print dialog box where you may specify the range of pages to be printed, the number of copies, the destination printer, and other printer setup options.

Url.Title: Print Setup (Macros)
Url.Abstract: Print Setup (Macros) Use this command to select a printer and a printer connection. This command presents a Print Setup dialog box, where you specify the printer and its connection.

Url.Title: Run (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Run (Macro) Select Run or its shortcut, Ctrl + R, to execute, or run, the current macro. You can choose to begin at step 1 of the macro or continue the macro from its current position as seen in the Macro Editor window.

Url.Title: Save File (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Save File (Macro) Select Save to save all of the macros currently available (as seen in the list displayed next to Macro/Open) to the currently loaded macro file.

Url.Title: Save File As (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Save File As (Macro) Select Save As to save all of the current macros to a macro file. This option is useful when you want to create a new macro file containing a specific set of macros that exist in the current file. When you select Save As, a window is displayed that allows you to select an existing macro file or create a new one. The filename that is shown when the window is opened is the one that is currently loaded.

Url.Title: Single Step (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Single Step (Macro) Select Single Step to run the current macro one step at a time. When you choose Single Step, you will need to press any key (except Escape) to proceed to the next step in the macro. If the macro is not currently on the first step, you have the option to go to the beginning or continue the macro from its current position.

Url.Title: Stop (Macro)
Url.Abstract: Stop (Macro) Select Stop to halt the currently executing macro. The process will stop immediately and a confirmation message will be displayed.

Url.Title: Add Variable (Macro Watch Popup)
Url.Abstract: Add Variable (Macro Watch Popup) This function is used to access one variable from the list of variables that are available within the current macro. The Macro Watch Add Variable window is displayed. Click on the desired variable name from the drop-down list displayed.

Url.Title: Delete All Variables (Macro Watch Popup)
Url.Abstract: Delete All Variables (Macro Watch Popup) This function is used to remove all variables from the Macro Watch List window.

Url.Title: Delete Variable (Macro Watch Popup)
Url.Abstract: Delete Variable (Macro Watch Popup) This function is used to remove a variable from the Macro Watch List window.

Url.Title: Modify Value (Macro Watch Popup)
Url.Abstract: Modify Value (Macro Watch Popup) This function is used to edit the value for the selected variable. To use this function, select the variable and right click to bring up the pop-up menu. Click on Modify Value to open the Macro Modify Variable window and edit the value.

Url.Title: Watch All Macros (Macro Watch Popup)
Url.Abstract: Watch All Macros (Macro Watch Popup) This function is used to add all of the variables, that are found in all of the macros in the current macro file, to the Macro Watch List window for debugging purposes.

Url.Title: Watch Macro (Marco Watch Popup)
Url.Abstract: Watch Macro (Marco Watch Popup) This function is used to add all of the variables that are found in the currently open macro to the Macro Watch List window for debugging purposes.

Url.Title: Radio Group Action
Url.Abstract: Radio Group Action Select one of the radio buttons displayed on the window listed below:

Url.Title: Autoqueue Window
Url.Abstract: Autoqueue Window Use this window to view, edit, export, print, or run the autoqueue, which is processed to perform Autoanalysis.

Url.Title: Autoqueue Parameters Window
Url.Abstract: Autoqueue Parameters Window This window is used to select the items to be included in a record that will be contained in the autoqueue for autoanalysis.

Url.Title: Macros Import Window
Url.Abstract: Macros Import Window Use this window to select the macro(s) that you want to import and add to the current macro file.

Url.Title: Macro Watch Add Variable Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Watch Add Variable Window This function is used to add a variable to the Macro Watch List window from the list of variables that are available within the current macro.

Url.Title: Macro Assign Clipboard Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Assign Clipboard Window The Assign Clipboard window is used to insert a macro step that will copy the current value of a macro variable and/or a text string to the clipboard. This is useful for building custom annotations and tables that are placed on a plot or added to a report.

Url.Title: Macro Assign Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Assign Window The Assign Variable macro step is used to store a numeric value into a macro variable. The numeric value to be assigned may come from a numeric constant, a number already stored in another macro variable, or a number loaded from the clipboard. The assign step can also be used to add, subtract, multiply, or divide the value of a variable by another value, or to apply a function (such as square root) to the value of a variable.

Url.Title: Macro Checkbox Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Checkbox Window Use this window to modify a checkbox selection that was captured as a step in your macro.

Url.Title: Macro Color Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Color Window Use this window to modify a color that was captured as a step in your macro. Click on the desired color. The letters FG (foreground) will be displayed on the chosen color. Select OK. The macro step will be modified accordingly.

Url.Title: Macro Comment Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Comment Window Use this window to add a comment to the currently displayed macro. Comment steps in an executing macro are skipped over and produce no action or display. They are for documentation purposes only.

Url.Title: Macro Custom Report Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Custom Report Window Use this window to modify a custom report that was captured as a step in your macro.

Url.Title: Macro Delay Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Delay Window Use the Macro Delay window to insert a time delay between two macro steps. Follow these steps to insert a Delay step into your macro:

Url.Title: Macro Dialog Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Dialog Window Use the Macro Dialog window to add a message box to your open macro. For example, a message box giving the allowable range for a specific analysis can be displayed, allowing comparison with the experimental result just obtained.

Url.Title: Macro Editor Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Editor Window Use this window to view a macro as you capture it and to edit a macro after capture.

Url.Title: Macro Edit Clipboard Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Edit Clipboard Window The Edit Clipboard macro step is used to display a dialog box in which you can view and edit the contents of the Windows clipboard. This is useful for entering custom text or multiple parameter values.

Url.Title: Macro Edit Variable Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Edit Variable Window The Edit Variable macro step is used to display a dialog box in which you can view and edit the contents of a macro variable. This is useful for entering or changing a result or macro parameter.

Url.Title: Macro Extended Text Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Extended Text Window Use this window to edit an extended text entry that was inserted as part of a macro dialog box. See also: Insert/Dialog.

Url.Title: Macro File Name Window
Url.Abstract: Macro File Name Window The Macro File Name window is used to insert a macro step that will identify the specified file (data file, session file, etc.) to open or save when the macro step runs.

Url.Title: Macro Grid Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Grid Window Use this window to modify a grid selection that was captured as a step in your macro. For example, grid selection can be captured as a change to the Plot Options symbols.

Url.Title: Macro Information Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Information Window Use the Macro Information window to enter two items regarding the macro file you are about to capture: The name, which is restricted to 30 characters and the Description, which is restricted to 300 characters.

Url.Title: Macro Jump Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Jump Window Use the Macro Jump window to move to a different step within the macro as the macro runs.

Url.Title: Macro Initialize Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Initialize Window Use the Macro Initialize window to insert a step that will open an initialization (.ini) file into your macro.

Url.Title: Macro Modify Variable Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Modify Variable Window This function is used to edit the value for the selected variable. To use this function, select the variable and right click to bring up the pop-up menu. Click on Modify Value to open this window. Edit the value for the variable selected and click OK when finished.

Url.Title: Macro Mouse/Cursor Position Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Mouse/Cursor Position Window Use this window to adjust the x and y coordinates that were captured as mouse or cursor movements in your macro.

Url.Title: Macro Test Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Test Window The Test Variable macro step is used to compare the current value of a macro variable with another variable or constant for conditional branching inside the macro. If the test condition is true then the macro will jump to the specified next step, otherwise macro execution will continue with the macro step immediately following the test variable step.

Url.Title: Macro Text Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Text Window Use this window to modify text that was captured as part of a step in your macro. Enter the desired text, then select OK. The macro step will be modified accordingly.

Url.Title: Macro Watch List Window
Url.Abstract: Macro Watch List Window Use this stay-on-top window to observe the variables that occur while a macro is running. This can help you to find out where problems exist within the macro steps.

Url.Title: Clear Button
Url.Abstract: Clear Button Click the Clear button to delete any entries in the database Save As window s Description box.

Url.Title: Find Next Button
Url.Abstract: Find Next Button Use this button to find and select the next occurrence of the text specified in the Find what field.

Url.Title: Replace Button
Url.Abstract: Replace Button Use this button to replace the selected instance of the search criteria, find the next occurrence, and then stop.

Url.Title: Replace All Button
Url.Abstract: Replace All Button Use this button to replace all occurrences of the search criteria in your document. To replace the occurrences one at a time, use the Replace button .

Url.Title: Checkbox Match Case
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Match Case Check Match case, if you want to find that exact set of characters in only the case typed.

Url.Title: Checkbox Match Whole Word Only
Url.Abstract: Checkbox Match Whole Word Only Check Match whole word only, if you want to find word that you have typed in the entry field without any prefixes, suffixes, etc.

Url.Title: Entry Find What
Url.Abstract: Entry Find What Enter the desired string of alphanumeric characters that you want to locate in the open document.

Url.Title: Entry Record Description
Url.Abstract: Entry Record Description Enter a description of the database file or click the Clipboard button to paste the information copied to the clipboard in the Description box. This description appears in the browse menu at the end of each record. The maximum length of this description is 255 total characters. NOTE: You can clear the description box by clicking the Clear button.

Url.Title: List Database Project
Url.Abstract: List Database Project Select the project that the record will be saved to. This project list contains the 21 CFR 11 projects that the person currently logged into the database has the right to access. If the list does not contain the desired project, check with the System Manager to obtain rights to that project.

Url.Title: List Database Record Type
Url.Abstract: List Database Record Type You can save the database record as a text (.txt) file or a Portable Document Format (.pdf) file that can be opened by Adobe Acrobat Reader. Select the desired type from the drop-down menu.

Url.Title: Copy (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Copy (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Copy option to copy the information to the clipboard for retrieval by the Edit/Paste option.

Url.Title: Cut (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Cut (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Cut option to remove information and place it on the clipboard for retrieval by the Edit/Paste option.

Url.Title: Delete (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Delete (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Delete option to delete the selected information.

Url.Title: Find (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Find (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Find option to locate a particular string of characters within your document. When you select this option the Find window is displayed.

Url.Title: Font (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Font (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Font option to access the Font window, which allows you to select a font, font type, font size, and effects.

Url.Title: Paste (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Paste (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Paste option to retrieve any information placed on the clipboard.

Url.Title: Replace (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Replace (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Replace menu to locate and replace a string of characters in the open document with another string (Text option) or to replace the space separators in the document with either tabs or commas. Some spread sheet programs will not separate the numerical data in a row unless there are either tabs or commas between the numerical data.

Url.Title: Select All (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Select All (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Select All option to highlight all of the text in the current file. You can then copy it to the clipboard for retrieval or delete it, etc.

Url.Title: Undo (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Undo (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Undo option to cancel the last action performed.

Url.Title: Word Wrap (Report Editor/Edit Menu)
Url.Abstract: Word Wrap (Report Editor/Edit Menu) Use the Word Wrap option to turn on (checked) or turn off (unchecked) the word wrapping capability in the text editor.

Url.Title: Close (Report Editor/File Menu)
Url.Abstract: Close (Report Editor/File Menu) Use the Close option to close the current file.

Url.Title: New (Report Editor/File Menu)
Url.Abstract: New (Report Editor/File Menu) Use the New menu item to start a new text file.

Url.Title: Open (Report Editor/File Menu)
Url.Abstract: Open (Report Editor/File Menu) Use the Open option to open an existing text file. Choosing this function accesses the Open file window, allowing you to browse and locate a text file.

Url.Title: Print (Report Editor/File Menu)
Url.Abstract: Print (Report Editor/File Menu) Use this command to print a document. This command presents a Print dialog box where you may specify the range of pages to be printed, the number of copies, the destination printer, and other printer setup options.

Url.Title: Print Setup (Report Editor/File Menu)
Url.Abstract: Print Setup (Report Editor/File Menu) Use this command to select a printer and a printer connection. This command presents a Print Setup dialog box, where you specify the printer and its connection.

Url.Title: Save As (Report Editor/File Menu)
Url.Abstract: Save As (Report Editor/File Menu) Use the Save As option to save the current file to a different directory or in a different file format. This function accesses the Save As window. Press the Help button on the window for more information.

Url.Title: Help on Report Editor
Url.Abstract: Help on Report Editor Use this function to access help on the Report Editor program.

Url.Title: Help Topics (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Help Topics (Report Editor) Use this menu item to display the topics available in the online help associated with the current instrument control dialog.

Url.Title: Autoqueue Log (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Autoqueue Log (Report Editor) Use the Autoqueue Log function to insert the log of the results obtained during autoanalysis. Each item in the log is made up of the pass/fail message, the data filename, the macro filename, the associated macro, and a short comment.

Url.Title: Autoqueue Report (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Autoqueue Report (Report Editor) Use the Autoqueue Report function to insert the list of records contained in the autoqueue for autoanalysis. Each record is made up of the data filename, macro filename, and associated macro.

Url.Title: Current Macro (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Current Macro (Report Editor) Use the Current Macro function to insert a listing of the macro steps contained in the currently open macro file.

Url.Title: Data Table (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Use the Data Table function to add a report showing the sample information and raw data points from the data file. For multiplexed data, such as frequency or amplitude, a separate table is generated for each multiplexed value.

Url.Title: Method Log (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Method Log (Report Editor) Use the Method Log function to insert a listing of the method segments that were used to obtain the data file. Each experimental method is made up of a group of segments, which are preprogrammed instructions that are sent to the analytical instrument.

Url.Title: Parameter Block (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Parameter Block (Report Editor) Use the Parameter Block function to insert a listing of the experimental parameters that were used when obtaining the data stored in the data file. When you select this item from the Insert menu, the parameter block information is inserted into the current data file.

Url.Title: Report Heading (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Report Heading (Report Editor) Use the Report Heading option on the Insert menu to insert the information contained in the report heading of the current data file into the open text file. The report heading contains the following information: file name, experiment run date, name of the program used for analysis, run number and the type of file. See the example below.

Url.Title: Results Report (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Results Report (Report Editor) Use the Results Report function to insert the results of your analysis in written report form. When you select this item from the Insert menu, the analysis results are inserted into the current text file.

Url.Title: Space Separators With Commas
Url.Abstract: Space Separators With Commas Use this menu option to automatically replace the space separators in the document with commas. Some spread sheet programs will not separate the numerical data in a row unless there are commas between the numerical data. After choosing this option, you can copy and paste or export the data in the report to another application, such as a spread sheet program.

Url.Title: Space Separators With Tabs
Url.Abstract: Space Separators With Tabs Use this menu option to automatically replace the space separators in the document with tabs. Some spread sheet programs will not separate the numerical data in a row unless there are tabs between the numerical data. After choosing this option, you can copy and paste or export the data in the report to another application, such as a spread sheet program.

Url.Title: Text
Url.Abstract: Text Use the Text menu option to locate and replace a string of characters in the open document with another string of characters. When you select this option the Replace window is displayed.

Url.Title: Find Window (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Find Window (Report Editor) Use this window to locate a string of characters within the open document. Follow these instructions to use this window:

Url.Title: Replace Window (Report Editor)
Url.Abstract: Replace Window (Report Editor) Use this window to locate and replace a string of characters in the open document. To use this window, follow these steps:

Url.Title: Save As Window
Url.Abstract: Save As Window Use this window to save a database file.
